data.title: Malawi Population
data.meta_description: Malawi Population, Malawi Population in 2019, Malawi Population Density, Malawi Life Expectancy, Malawi Fertility Rate, Malawi Population by Religion, Malawi Population Global Rank, Malawi Population Growth Rate, Malawi population projection graph, Malawi Population projection by 2050
data.text:
Highlights of Analysis:

Malawi Population is increasing

Malawi Population Density is increasing

Malawi Life Expectancy is increasing

Malawi Fertility Rate is decreasing

Every year Malawi population is expected to increase by 672705 people. Malawi contributes 0.37% of world's total population. Average Life Expectancy in Malawi is 64.738 and is expected to Increase in upcoming next 50 years.Life Expectancy is below average when compared to global average (Currently Hong Kong Ranks 1st for Life Expectancy of 85 years). How the world population is changing is of great importance for humanity’s impact on the Earth’s natural environment, but it also gives reasons to hope for a good future. Malawi owns 0.00063% of land i.e. 94280 Sq Kms of land and Ranks 109 when compared to other Global Countries Land area

Malawi Population, Density, Fertility Rate and Life Expectancy Overview Malawi Population Analysis Year 2010 Year 2020 Year 2030 Malawi Population (in million) 15.16 20.28 26.57 Malawi Global Rank 65th 61st 60th Malawi Global Population Share 0.21% 0.26% 0.31% Malawi Global Population Density 162.33 212.46 267.91 Malawi Global Population Density Rank 186th 188th 190th Malawi Average Life Expectancy 57.26 64.73 68.84 Malawi Average Life Expectancy Global Rank 178th 168th 157th Malawi Fertility Rate 5.3 4.31 3.71 Malawi Fertility Rate Global Rank 20th 28th 27th

Note : Population Density means number of people staying per kilometer and Fertility rate means number of kids born per women

What is the Population trend of Malawi ?

Every year Malawi population is expected to increase by 672705 people.

Malawi population overall trend is expected to be Decreasing for next 50 years and expected to be in Decreasing trend for next 100 years.

Malawi will see more birth rate than death rate for next 100 years.

Malawi Global Population Rank for next 50 years is expected to be in Range of 61st-51st.

What is the Population growth rate of Malawi ?

Malawi population average growth rate for next 50 years is increasing at Rate of 2.45%.

Overall population growth rate of Malawi is expected to be decreasing.

What percentage of worlds population lives in Malawi ?

Malawi contributes 0.37% of world's total population.

Malawi Population Density

What is the Population Density of Malawi ?

Malawi population density is 321.02 per sq. km and is expected to be Decreasing for next 50 years.

Malawi Ranks in range of 188th-196th in term of population density around the world.

As per trend, their will be decrease in population density of Malawi.

Table : Past and Expected Future Population Density (people per sq. km.)

`

Year Population Density Rank 2010 162.33 186th 2020 212.46 188th 2030 267.91 190th 2040 323.46 192nd 2050 378.38 194th 2060 422.91 196th 2070 460.62 198th 2080 488.85 200th 2090 505.51 202nd 2100 509.29 204th

Malawi Average Life Expectancy

What is the Average Life Expectancy in Malawi ?

Average Life Expectancy in Malawi is 64.738 and is expected to Increase in upcoming next 50 years.

Life Expectancy is below average when compared to global average (Currently Hong Kong Ranks 1st for Life Expectancy of 85 years).

Malawi ranks 168th in terms of average life expectancy around the world.

Table : Past and Expected Average Life Expectancy (Age) (Source)

Year Average Life Expectancy Rank 2010 57.26 178th 2020 64.73 168th 2030 68.84 157th 2040 71.92 155th 2050 74.12 151st 2060 76.08 147th 2070 77.62 147th 2080 78.89 147th 2090 80.1 150th 2100 0

Malawi Average Fertility Rate

What is the Average Fertility Rate of Malawi ?

In Malawi, Women gives birth to 4.313 (average) children every year and this fertility rate is expected to be in decreasing trend.

Malawi rank is in range of 28th-26th in term of average fertility rate around the world.

Table : Past and Expected Average Fertility Rate

Year Average Fertility Rate Rank 2010 5.3 20th 2020 4.31 28th 2030 3.71 27th 2040 3.26 28th 2050 2.92 29th 2060 2.65 26th 2070 2.44 27th 2080 2.26 26th 2090 2.11 28th 2100 2.01 30th

Conclusion of Analysis :

In 1950, Malawi population was 2953871 and this continuously increasing at growth rate of average 0.02%.Currently Malawi population is around 15167095 and by year 2030 its expected to be 26578247 .Malawi ranks 65th when compared to other countries population. Average Life Expectancy of Malawi in 2010 was 57.263, in 2020 its 64.738 and by 2050 it will be 74.127.As mentioned in Highlight's Malawi population is increasing, population density is increasing, average life expectancy is increasing and average fertility rate is decreasing.

Reference (Source) :

https://population.un.org/wpp/

https://population.un.org/wpp/DataSources/

https://www.wikipedia.org/

Historical population data on a sub-national level – including their administrative divisions and principal towns – is collected by Jan Lahmeyer and published at his website www.populstat.info.

The Minnesota Population Center publishes various high-quality datasets based on census data beginning in 1790. At the time of writing this source was online at www.pop.umn.edu/index.php. It focuses on North America and Europe.

The Data & Information Services Center (DISC) Archive at University of Wisconsin-Madison provides access to census data and population datasets (mostly for the Americas). At the time of writing this source was online at http://www.disc.wisc.edu.

The International Database published by the U.S. Census Bureau provides data for the time 1950-2100. At the time of writing this source was online at https://www.census.gov/data-tools/demo/idb/informationGateway.php.

The Atlas of the Biosphere publishes data on Population Density. At the time of writing this source was online at www.sage.wisc.edu/atlas/maps.
